summary: Cat's ear is the common name for several species of flowering plants:  Hypochaeris species, especially Hypochaeris radicata Some Calochortus species, also called mariposa lilies

flower.description: It blooms one by one at the end of a douhwa branch, about 3cm in diameter, arranged in 3 overlapping rows of involucre, standing upright, in a row on the central vein. 5 inches at the tip of the tongue. Long hair on the top of the trunk. 1/2 of the crown tube. Burn scale 1.5 cm, membranous, 1 vein.

shape.stem: Many stems, hairless and thin. Scales 2-10 mm long are attached here and there, later becoming black.
shape.leaf: rhizome. escape type. 4-12 cm long, 1-2 cm wide, 4-8 pairs of pinnate fissures or deep fissures, both sides yellowish-brown, densely packed with long hairs.
shape.fruit: Spiny projections grow densely on the surface of the fruit. It has a very thin beak.

habitat.domestic: Fields, roadsides, grasslands, lawns, open fields, etc.
